name: Mitochondrial Neurogastrointestinal Encephalomyopathy (MNGIE)
chief_complaint: I feel weak all the time, my stomach hurts after eating, and I've lost a lot of weight.
prognosis: Poor without treatment, with progressive deterioration leading to death typically in 3rd-4th decade. Early diagnosis and treatment may improve outcomes.
description: MNGIE is an ultra-rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the TYMP gene leading to thymidine phosphorylase deficiency. This results in accumulation of toxic nucleosides that impair mitochondrial DNA replication, causing multi-system dysfunction particularly affecting the nervous system and gastrointestinal tract.
